Build an inclusive digital future


"Governments are increasingly putting the digital transformation at front and centre of policy agendas. Many governments had strengthened their strategic approach to the digital transformation prior to the COVID-19 pandemic." "The virtuous circle between digital innovation and digital transformation is a fundamental driver of new business models and markets, and digital technologies hold the potential to strengthen the science and research systems that are proving so critical to countries’ COVID-19 response and recovery" "This strategic trend is encouraging, but may not be enough to ensure a resilient and more inclusive digital future. The COVID-19 crisis reinforces the need for a co-ordinated, whole-of-government policy approach to digital transformation. This requires a balancing act that will Not be the same for all countries, as cultural, social and economic factors influence the most suitable policy environment." https://www.oecd.org/digital/digital-economy-outlook-covid.pdf

"Meanwhile, mobile applications were developed to help “track and trace” the development of the pandemic; and researchers employed artificial intelligence (AI) to learn more about the virus and accelerate the search for a vaccine." Internet Usage


"Internet users ranged from over 95% to less than 70% of the adult population in 2019, and there are important demographic differences in Internet use. Although 58% of those aged 50-74 used the Internet daily in 2019 – up from only 30% in 2010 – this remains well below the average share of daily Internet users aged 16-24 (the so-called “digital natives”), which was close to 95%." "There are also persistent skills gaps across demographic groups and countries, with people of higher skill or income levels making better use of the Internet and online activities, and being better able to access knowledge, job opportunities, and health and education services." https://www.oecd.org/digital/digital-economy-outlook-covid.pdf
